description: Generate non-overlapping balls. The process ceases when the target number of balls are created or when the number of attempts to place balls without overlap is achieved. This command contrasts with ball distribute where balls are distributed without regard for overlap until a target porosity is achieved.

keywords.name: number
keywords.description: Number of balls to generate (stopping criterion)

keywords.name: box
keywords.description: Generation box (balls fully contained, no overlap with box faces)

keywords.name: id
keywords.description: Starting ID (default: next available). If idhi given, number = idhi - idlow + 1

keywords.name: cubic
keywords.description: Regular cubic packing. Uses radlow for spacing (2*radlow apart). Fills region completely

keywords.name: hexagonal
keywords.description: Hexagonal (2D) / face-centered-cubic (3D) packing. Uses radhi for spacing, radlow-radhi for radii

keywords.name: gauss
keywords.description: Gaussian distribution: mean=(radlow+radhi)/2, std=(radhi-radlow)/2. Optional f (default 0.1) sets minimum radius

keywords.name: fish-distribution
keywords.description: FISH function returns ball radius. Cannot use with cubic/hexagonal/gauss/radius

keywords.name: group
keywords.description: Assign generated balls to group s

examples.description: Generate 100 balls with radii 0.5-0.7 in left half of domain (non-overlapping)
Generate cubic packing with ball radius 0.25 (spacing = 0.5)
Generate hexagonal close packing with radii 0.3-0.5

examples.command: ball generate radius 1.0 1.5 gauss 0.1 number 500 tries 50000
examples.description: Generate 500 balls with Gaussian distribution, up to 50,000 attempts
Generate balls with IDs 1-500, assign to group 'layer1'

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('ball generate ...') - Python SDK only has itasca.ball.create() for single ball creation
